meanings.definition: The act or practice of inserting standardized marks or symbols in written or printed matter to clarify meaning and separate structural units.
meanings.sent1: Proper punctation helps readers understand the text better.
meanings.sent2: I learned about punctation in my English class.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's punctation on the whiteboard was so neat, it looked like art!
meanings.sent4: Her punctation of emotions in her writing was truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The punctation in the book made the story come alive.

meanings.definition: The marks used in writing or printing to separate sentences, clarify meaning, or indicate pauses.
meanings.sent1: Commas and periods are common forms of punctation.
meanings.sent2: The punctation in this article makes it easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The punctation in the text message made it sound like the sender was whispering.
meanings.sent4: His use of punctation created a rhythm in the poem.
meanings.sent5: The punctation in the play added dramatic effect.
